results.title: Beyond the roaring forties
results.creator_credit: Conon Fraser, Derek Wright and New Zealand National Film Unit
results.brief_description: Shows the Natural History of New Zealand’s subantartic islands. New Zealand’s subantartic Islands of “The Snares”, Auckland Island, Campbell Island, Bounty Island, Macquarie Island and Antipodes Island house unique species of birds and marine mammals. These rarely visited islands are under the auspice of the Royal New Zealand Navy who are carefully observing and measuring the geological, geographical, isoseismal changes and are maintaining vital observations of wildlife and vegetation patterns. Narrated by Ray Henwood.

results.title: Beyond the rift wall
results.creator_credit: Charlotte Gobeil, Canadian Broadcasting Corporation and Canadian International Development Agency
results.brief_description: A film about a group of farmers and their wives who went to live and work among the Tanzanians, training them in Canadian methods of grain growing and production. It examines the cultural effects of this exchange both on the Canadians, who found themselves isolated by geography and language, and on the Tanzanians who were exposed to Canadian work habits and technology.

results.title: Beyond the naked eye
results.creator_credit: Claudia Overing, Francois Seguillon and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A film of marvels, an amazing view of the living, pulsing universe contained in a single drop of water from a fish aquarium. Colour film and a microscope, and the infinite patience of the filmmakers, reveal life that no-one would ordinarily see. This is a view of creation, of birth, life and death, of the laws of nature that apply even to the smallest of living things. It is a film that will add knowledge and insight to the pleasure of any audience. Photographers: Eric Chamberlain, Claudia Overing. Narrated by Sharry Plett and Albert Martin. Awards: Tehran; Belgrade; Melbourne.

results.title: Beyond the mind's eye
results.creator_credit: Michael Boydstun, Steven Churchill and Miramar
results.brief_description: Beyond the mind’s eye offers a compilation of computer animation from around the world. The emphasis is on psychodelic fantasy and “gee wiz” special effects, with original music by Jan Hammer. The viewer is taken on a surreal voyage that explores imaginative visions of a technological future, the outer reaches of the universe and alternate dimensions filled with colour and movement.

results.title: Beyond the frozen edge
results.brief_description: A compilation of 10 four minute programmes based on a 6 week trip by Rob Gell on the Antarctic supply vessel “Icebird” to the Australian Scientific Research Stations in Antarctica.

results.title: Beyond the frame (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: B.Z. Vincent-Batyka, Tate Gallery and Royal College of Art (Great Britain)
results.brief_description: In attempting to break down the barriers between art galleries and the general public, the Tate Gallery gives lectures to groups of adults and is involved in a special program for children, called Kid’s Play, to help them appreciate the different types and forms of art.

results.title: Beyond the clouds = Par-dela les nuages
results.creator_credit: Michelangelo Antonioni, Stephen Tchal Gadjieff, Philippe Carcassonne, Cecchi Gori Group, Road Movies Zweite Produktionen, France 3 Cinema, Cine B and Sunshine
results.brief_description: This was Antonioni’s return to filmmaking after suffering a stroke in 1985. He presents 4 vignettes linked thematically by notions of desire, as well as a fictional director in search of a story (portrayed by John Malkovich). In the first story two beautiful lovers, Silvano and Carmen (Kim Rossi Stuart and Ines Sastre) are unable to consummate their love because of his pursuit of perfection. In the second story John Malkovich’s character meets a woman (Sophie Marceau) who confesses to killing her father. The third story involves a man (Peter Weller) who must decide between his wife (Fanny Ardant) and his lover (Chiara Caselli). In the final story a man (Vincent Perez) becomes obsessed with a woman (Irene Jacob) who is “satisfied” with life and is about to enter a convent. Screen legends Jeanne Moreau and Marcello Mastroianni make a brief appearance and have an overall involvement to the story rather than being directly involved with any of the vignettes. In French, Italian and English with English subtitles. Co-directed by Wim Wenders.

results.title: Beyond the border crossing
results.creator_credit: Ted Davis and Victoria. Dept. of Agriculture
results.brief_description: States in the north of Australia are the home of the Queensland Fruit Fly, the predator which each year can destroy million of dollars worth of fruit and vegetables. Shows the precautions which are taken to keep the fruit fly out of Victoria and the methods used to control it once it is discovered. Stresses the need for the co-operation of every traveller entering Victoria by land, sea or air. Photography by Ted Davis. Narrated by Terry McDermott.

results.title: Beyond the boom: metal mining in Australia
results.creator_credit: Lilias Castle, Norman Castle, Australian Mining Industry Council and Fraser Castle Productions
results.brief_description: The evolution of mining in Australia from the first gold discoveries to the iron, nickel and copper developments of the 1960’s , its historic importance in national growth and economic stability and in the exploration and settling of much of Australia. The scope of modern mining and processing industries, exploration and prospecting, the growth of new towns and stimulation of regional development.
